name: AFI's Top 100 Movies Quiz | Awards and Festivals | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which movie was voted the number one movie of all time?
Which actor was the only actor to star in two of the top 10 films?
questions.explanation:
Marlon Brando.

	Brando starred in The Godfather and On The Waterfront.

questions.text: Which year had the most films in the top 100 list?
questions.explanation:
1939.

	In 1939, five films made the list, which were: Gone With The Wind, The Wizard Of Oz, Stagecoach, Wuthering Heights, and Mr Smith Goes To Washington.

questions.text: Which actress starred in the most movies on the list?
questions.explanation:
Katharine Hepburn.

	Hepburn is the most represented leading actress with four films.

questions.text: How many silent films are on the list?
Who directed the most movies on the list?
questions.explanation:
Steven Spielberg.

	Spielberg directed five of the 100 Greatest AFI movies.

questions.text: Which decade did NOT have a movie representing the top ten list?
questions.explanation:
1980s.

	Raging Bull was the hightest rated film from the 1980s at number 24.

questions.text: Which decade had the most movies representing the list?
questions.explanation:
1950s.

	The 1950s had 20 films on the list.

questions.text: Which movie was NOT represented in the AFI Top 100?
